nodes.label: Gas Station
nodes.graphic_text: A gas station where gasoline is pumped into the car.
nodes.definition: Fueling station where gasoline is supplied to the vehicle.

nodes.label: Car
nodes.graphic_text: A car that uses gasoline for motion.
nodes.definition: A vehicle that uses gasoline for propulsion and produces exhaust.

nodes.label: Atmosphere
nodes.graphic_text: The air into which the car's exhaust is emitted.
nodes.definition: The air around the car that absorbs exhaust gases.

flows.label: Gasoline
flows.definition: The flow of gasoline from the gas station to the car.

conversion_formulas.description: This is for complete combustion, see below for incomplete combustion.
This is for incomplete combustion, which also produces nitrous oxides and particulates.

flows.label: Motion
flows.definition: The motion generated by the car as it consumes gasoline. The explosion of the gasoline in the piston chamber produces motion of the piston.

flows.label: Exhaust
flows.definition: The exhaust gases released by the car into the atmosphere. CO2, CO, H20, and nitrous oxides

flows.label: Air
flows.definition: Air required for combustion of gasoline.

pages.title: Car Subsystems
pages.keywords: car, gasoline, air, exhaust, combustion, engine, motion

nodes.label: Fuel Tank
nodes.graphic_text: Stores gasoline before it is sent to the engine.
nodes.definition: The car&#039;s fuel storage system for gasoline.

nodes.label: Fuel Injector
nodes.graphic_text: Injects gasoline into the combustion chamber.
nodes.definition: Injects gasoline into the car&#039;s engine for combustion.

nodes.label: Combustion Chamber
nodes.graphic_text: Car engine showing pistons and cylinders.
nodes.definition: The place where air and gasoline combust to produce power.

nodes.label: Pistons
nodes.graphic_text: Pistons move as a result of combustion to create motion.
nodes.definition: Converts the explosion from combustion into motion.

nodes.label: Drive Subsystem
nodes.definition: Converts the linear motion of the piston to rotational for the wheels

nodes.label: Exhaust System
nodes.graphic_text: Emits exhaust gases from the engine to the atmosphere.
nodes.definition: Removes exhaust gases from the combustion process.

nodes.label: Air Intake
nodes.definition: Air intake subsystem for fuel combustion

flows.label: Gasoline Flow
flows.definition: Flow of gasoline from the fuel tank to the fuel injector.

flows.label: Gasoline to Combustion
flows.definition: Gasoline injected into the combustion chamber.

conversion_formulas.formula: Gasoline + Oxygen -&gt; Carbon Dioxide and Water with some carbon  monoxide

flows.label: Combustion to Motion
flows.definition: Combustion generates motion through the movement of pistons.

flows.label: Exhaust Gases
flows.definition: Exhaust gases generated by combustion are expelled.

flows.label: Linear Motion
flows.definition: Linear motion to be converted to rotational motion in the drive assembly

flows.label: Air
flows.definition: Air for combustion

pages.title: Drive Subsystem
pages.keywords: drive subsystem, pistons, crankshaft, transmission, differential, wheels, linear motion

nodes.label: Pistons
nodes.graphic_text: Convert combustion energy into linear motion.
nodes.definition: The pistons move linearly in the cylinders, driven by the force of combustion.

nodes.label: Crankshaft
nodes.graphic_text: Converts the piston&#039;s linear motion into rotational motion.
nodes.definition: The crankshaft transforms the up-and-down motion of the pistons into rotational motion.

nodes.label: Flywheel
nodes.graphic_text: Stores rotational energy from the crankshaft.
nodes.definition: The flywheel stabilizes the rotational motion and stores energy for smooth power delivery.

nodes.label: Transmission
nodes.graphic_text: Adjusts the rotational speed and torque to suit driving conditions.
nodes.definition: The transmission regulates power and adjusts rotational speed and torque before sending it to the drive shaft.

nodes.label: Differential
nodes.graphic_text: Allows the wheels to rotate at different speeds during turns.
nodes.definition: The differential adjusts the rotation of the wheels, allowing them to rotate at different speeds during turns.

nodes.label: Wheels
nodes.graphic_text: Convert rotational motion back into linear motion to move the car.
nodes.definition: The wheels convert the rotational motion from the drivetrain into linear motion to move the car forward.

flows.label: Linear to Rotational Motion
flows.definition: Pistons&#039; linear motion is converted into rotational motion by the crankshaft.

flows.label: Rotational Energy Storage
flows.definition: Rotational motion is stabilized and stored in the flywheel.

flows.label: Power Regulation
flows.definition: The flywheel sends rotational motion to the transmission for regulation.

flows.label: Rotational Speed Adjustment
flows.definition: The transmission sends rotational motion to the differential, which adjusts speed for each wheel.

flows.label: Rotational to Linear Motion
flows.keywords: rotational motion, linear motion, car movement
flows.definition: The wheels convert rotational motion from the differential back into linear motion, moving the car forward.

flows.label: Linear Motion
flows.keywords: rotational motion, linear motion, car movement
flows.definition: The linear motion of the car from the rotation of the wheels

pages.title: Air Intake Subsystem
pages.keywords: air intake, combustion, engine, air filter, throttle body, MAF sensor, intake valves

nodes.label: Air Filter
nodes.graphic_text: Filters dust and debris from the incoming air.
nodes.definition: A filter that removes contaminants from the air entering the engine.

nodes.label: Throttle Body
nodes.graphic_text: Regulates the amount of air flowing into the engine.
nodes.definition: The throttle body controls air flow to the engine based on the driver&#039;s input.

nodes.label: Mass Airflow Sensor (MAF)
nodes.graphic_text: Measures the amount of air entering the engine.
nodes.definition: The MAF sensor determines the quantity of air entering the engine, ensuring the right air-fuel mixture.
nodes.keywords: MAF sensor, air intake, engine control

nodes.label: Intake Manifold
nodes.graphic_text: Distributes air evenly to each cylinder of the engine.
nodes.definition: The intake manifold directs air to each cylinder for combustion.

nodes.label: Intake Valves
nodes.graphic_text: Controls air flow into the combustion chamber.
nodes.definition: Intake valves open to allow air into the combustion chamber and close during compression.
nodes.keywords: intake valves, air intake, combustion chamber

flows.label: Filtered Air
flows.definition: Air flows from the air filter to the throttle body after filtration.

flows.label: Regulated Air Flow
flows.definition: The throttle body regulates the air flow and passes it to the MAF sensor.

flows.label: Measured Air Flow
flows.definition: The MAF sensor measures air flow and passes it to the intake manifold.

flows.label: Air to Combustion Chamber
flows.definition: Air passes through the intake manifold and into the combustion chamber via intake valves.
